summary.Title: HUMAN RIGHTS DATA SPECIALIST
summary.Presentation: The Human Rights and Development Department works in the interrelated fields of human rights and sustainable development, with the aim of promoting human rights through sustainable development process

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Human Rights and Development Department works in the interrelated fields of human rights and sustainable development, with the aim of promoting human rights through sustainable development processes.

We work with strategic partners, including national authorities, UN agencies, civil society networks and National Human Rights Institutions. We develop tools and analysis and build capacity to integrate human rights into sustainable development processes around the world. This work draws heavily on our innovative human rights data tools – comprising text-mining tools and indicator-based monitoring tools.

In continuation of this, we contribute to the Institute’s broader work on human rights and technology, where our instrumentalist approach to applying technology to generate, store and process data for strategic promotion of human rights, complements the wider work of the institute on protecting human rights in the digital sphere.

Your role An important part of your role as our new human rights data specialist will be to work with colleagues to build and maintain partnerships with relevant human rights actors, with a focus on data and accountability.

You will also be responsible for maintaining relationships with technical service providers, for example IT developers.

You will oversee and coordinate maintenance of databases and digital data collection tools relevant to the projects that the team is engaged in, including the SDG Data Explorer

Your qualifications and competencies Essential

  • Educational background in human rights, data science, social sciences or another relevant field – or a combination thereof
  • Experience of working with large datasets, data-mining, developing and maintaining databases and digital tools, and presenting data-based analysis visually
  • Experience in work with human rights in the digital sphere/human rights and technology
  • Previous experience of working with human rights or in a human rights-related sustainable development field
  • Knowledge of the relevant national and international monitoring and reporting mechanisms for sustainable development and human rights.
  • Keen interest in natural language processing and machine learning (experience is an asset)
  • Ability to learn fast and to work with a variety of stakeholders – in-house as well as externally
  • Fluency in English
Desirable

  • Good understanding of human rights and SDG indicators
  • Experience using content management systems (especially Drupal) is an asset as well as experience in handling and analysing datasets with a spreadsheet program or SQL language
  • Basic understanding of PowerBi, and an interest to learn more
  • Basic understanding of statistics programmes such as Python or R, and an interest to learn more
  • Experience in project management and coordination
  • Knowledge of French, Spanish and/or a Scandinavian language
About you In addition to the above-mentioned competencies, we are looking for:

  • a structured thinker with a keen interest in using technology and data for the promotion and protection of human rights;
  • a team player, who works well with others;
  • someone who can be proactive and work independently; and
  • someone who is willing to learn fast and develop new skills and knowledge on the job.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT You will be based at the Danish Institute for Human Rights’ headquarters.

The position is full-time, based in Copenhagen, with some international travel. Salary is set in accordance with the Danish Ministry of Finance’s agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations.

Contact and how to apply If you have any questions, please contact Department Director, Sille Stidsen at sist@humanrights.dk.

Send your application using the link on this page.

Deadline for application: 20 May, 2022
